Experiment Method.Assay Method: In vitro kinase activity assay and immunoprecipitation followed by Western blot analysis

Material used.Material Source: Cell line and transfected mammalian cells tagged with myc or GFP
Material used.Material Name: Human diploid fibroblasts (HEK293) and transfected cells
Material used.Description: In vitro kinase activity was tested using artificial kinase-dead mutants. PINK1 localization was analyzed using immunoprecipitation followed by Western blot.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression was abolished in G309D mutant.
Protein expression was reduced by 50% in L347P mutant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each mutation type.

Technical replicates.Technical replicates: Two technical replicates were used for Western blot analysis.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control in vitro kinase assays.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control for immunoprecipitation.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes, Western blot is a standard method in studying kinase activity.
